JUDGES: Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger;Stanislav Shevchuk
TEXT: The applicant , PERSON Malkova , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr Y. GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
The applicant ’s son was the victim of a crime which , in her opinion , was ineffectively investigated by the domestic authorities .
On DATE the applicant notified ORG that as from DATE she would hold a CARDINAL - person protest demonstration in front of the building of ORG ( hereafter “ the ORG ” ) .
On DATE the ORG confirmed to the applicant she was entitled to hold a protest demonstration at the place and time specified .
On DATE the ORG instituted proceedings in ORG of the Chekassy ( hereafter “ the ORG ” ) seeking to prohibit the applicant ’s protest demonstration .

On DATE Mr L. and Mr PERSON , who were the officials of ORG , arrived at the applicant ’s home , handed her the summons to the hearing and proposed to give her a lift to ORG as the hearing had been scheduled for DATE . The officials allegedly also promised that they would bring her back home after the hearing . The applicant agreed .

DATE ORG , having considered the case , prohibited the applicant ’s protest demonstration . ORG held , in particular , that the applicant ’s demonstration , in the course of which she was planning to use a loudspeaker , would have a negative effect on the work of the officials in the building of ORG , who were investigating serious offences , questioning witnesses , suspects and the accused , including those who were detained and escorted to the building . Moreover , the demonstration would divert the police officers from their duties in other parts of the city which might result in jeopardising public order and infringing the rights and freedoms of other citizens .
On CARDINAL DATE the ORG ( hereafter “ ORG ” ) , following the applicant ’s appeal , upheld the judgment of ORG .

On DATE ORG allowed the applicant ’s appeal in cassation , quashed the decisions of the lower courts and rejected the claim of ORG . ORG stated , in particular , that it was for the other competent authorities , but not for ORG , to institute the proceedings at issue .

On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings in ORG , seeking compensation for the non - pecuniary damage incurred as a result of the allegedly unlawful actions of ORG . She claimed that on DATE Mr L. and Mr PERSON had taken her to ORG and had promised to take her back home . However , after the hearing they had not kept their promise , despite her poor health , and she had had to go home by public transport which had aggravated her illness . The applicant enclosed with her claim , among other documents , the decision of CARDINAL DATE taken by ORG .

On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s claim as unsubstantiated , holding , in particular , that the applicant had not been physically or psychologically forced by Mr L. and Mr PERSON to go with them to the court hearing and no unlawful actions on the part of PERSON L. and Mr PERSON could be discerned . These findings were based , inter alia , on the submissions of the applicant who confirmed at the court hearing that she had not quarrelled with PERSON L. and Mr PERSON and had voluntarily agreed to go with them to ORG .

On DATE , following the applicant ’s appeal , ORG upheld the judgment of ORG , finding that the officials of ORG had not violated any legislation when they , upon the applicant ’s consent , had helped her go to ORG .
On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal in cassation as unsubstantiated .
The relevant extract of the LAW provides as follows :

ORG have the right to assemble peacefully without arms and to hold meetings , rallies , processions and demonstrations , upon notifying in advance the bodies of executive power or bodies of local self - government .

Restrictions on the exercise of this right may be established by a court in accordance with the law and only in the interests of national security and public order , with the purpose of preventing disturbances or crimes , protecting the health of the population , or protecting the rights and freedoms of other persons . ”
